distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for grub2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2023-4692: Fixed an out-of-bounds write at fs/ntfs.c which may lead to unsigned code execution. (bsc#1215935)
- CVE-2023-4693: Fixed an out-of-bounds read at fs/ntfs.c which may lead to leak sensitive information. (bsc#1215936)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in grub2's NTFS filesystem driver. This issue may allow an attacker to present a specially crafted NTFS filesystem image, leading to grub's heap metadata corruption. In some circumstances, the attack may also corrupt the UEFI firmware heap metadata. As a result, arbitrary code execution and secure boot protection bypass may be achieved.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: An out-of-bounds read flaw was found on grub2's NTFS filesystem driver. This issue may allow a physically present attacker to present a specially crafted NTFS file system image to read arbitrary memory locations. A successful attack allows sensitive data cached in memory or EFI variable values to be leaked, presenting a high Confidentiality risk.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
